snippet: The Legislature has approved a proposal that could have students commit a percentage of future income for university payment, but it faces procedural and practical hurdles.
abstract: Oregon Legislature approves plan that could allow students to attend state colleges without paying tuition or taking out traditional loans; instead, they would commit a small percentage of their future incomes to repaying the state; proposal faces procedural and practical hurdles, but could point to new direction in debate over how to cope with rising cost of higher education.
lead_paragraph: The Legislature has approved a proposal that could have students commit a percentage of future income for university payment, but it faces procedural and practical hurdles.

headline.main: Oregon Looks at Way to Attend College Now and Repay State Later
headline.print_headline: Oregon Looks at Way to Attend College Now and Repay State Later
